meanings.definition: The quality or state of being like a swain.
meanings.sent1: Her swainishnesses shone through as she tended to the animals on the farm.
meanings.sent2: The swainishnesses of the young man made him a natural caretaker.
meanings.sent3: In a play, the character's swainishnesses led to many comedic situations.
meanings.sent4: His swainishnesses were like a beacon of kindness in a world of indifference.
meanings.sent5: The swainishnesses of the hero endeared him to all who knew him.

meanings.definition: The behaviors or characteristics of a swain.
meanings.sent1: The swainishnesses of the gentleman were evident in his chivalrous actions.
meanings.sent2: She admired his swainishnesses, such as opening doors and pulling out chairs.
meanings.sent3: His swainishnesses sometimes made him seem like a character from a fairy tale.
meanings.sent4: The swainishnesses of the prince charmed all who met him.
meanings.sent5: In the story, the swainishnesses of the knight saved the day.

meanings.definition: The actions or attitudes typical of a swain.
meanings.sent1: His swainishnesses included bringing flowers and writing love letters.
meanings.sent2: The swainishnesses of the suitor won her heart.
meanings.sent3: The swainishnesses of the character were endearing to all who knew him.
meanings.sent4: Her swainishnesses were like a breath of fresh air in the city.
meanings.sent5: The swainishnesses of the protagonist made the story heartwarming.
